title.narrative: 2. QUALITY CHILD HEALTH SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2020, the Ministry of Health's technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child health services, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community., which contributes to Child Health, Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the Ministry of Health’s technical departments are better equipped to improve quality of integrated child health services, targeting preventable diseases in particular, at health care facilities and in the community.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the MoH to implement high impact interventions such as immunization, integrated management of childhood illness (IMCI), iCCM and chemoprevention of seasonal malaria for children aged 3-59 months to improve children's health. Concerning immunization, 331,707 children 0-11 months were vaccinated with Penta3 and 323,225 children against measles and rubella. A total of 117,700 disease episodes of children under the age of 5 were managed by CBHWs at community level, while 87% of them were treated according to the (IMCI approach in health facilities | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
